comment: shes the goat, the work she assigns is nothing too much. her field of interest and her background is extremely interesting and makes her lectures incredibly fun.
I had her for love and sex. Grades extremely harsh and looks to take points off for no reason. We had discussion posts, short answer quizzes, and 2 PowerPoints. I wouldn't take her again.

Dr Liz is the sweetest professor ever. I enjoyed this class so much! It was a bit lecture heavy but everything she talked about was really interesting. There are 4 written discussions, 3 ppt presentations and 2 exams and a final project. Super light course load I would definitely recommend her

Dr Liz is an amazing teacher. Highly recommend. Very funny. Have a total of 4 quizzes. Quizzes are online open note with lockdown browser no camera necessary. A project you have to present in front of the class but isnt as bad as it seems will take 4-5 mins. No class on days of quizzes. TAKE HER!

My FAVORITE prof. She was kind, concise, organized and helpful. Respectful to all students. Surprised she doesn't have a 5. Copy down PPTs word for word & you'll get easy A's on quizzes. Mini essays are quick and easy. The 1 presentation was fun to do, and you do have to talk (if online still). Only take class if truly interested in Asia culture.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: She is passionate about the subject. She can be rude though. She gives 2 essays and it always seemed like she was searching for reasons to take points off even when the paper meets the rubric. She also plays favorites. Will grade different students papers different based on how much she likes you.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: 3 essays and 1 presentation. Easy weekly quizzes if you have good memory. Lecture videos reused from Summer '19 which would be ok but too high of expectations to not actually be teaching us. Always hunted for ways to take points off essays even when all criteria met. Pages and pages of weekly reading for no reason. ie: no discussion/not on quiz.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: Her class is organized, and is not too difficult if you pay attention. You have to take notes, and do outside readings. You will get a good grade if you do these things. She can be rude. She complained multiple times through the semester when students would ask questions or to go to a previous slide. She reads very quickly. tests/ 2 essays.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Sensei Miles is AMAZING. I took her for Asian Studies 1102 online and she is great. The work is easy, no hw, 4 quizzes with NO webcam, 2 essays, and a news presentation project(but that was easy). Her lectures arent boring and the subject is interesting. And she is very understanding and easy to reach out to. 10/10 would definitely recommend.

Professor Miles is amazing. Very easy class. Tests are exactly what's on her lectures. A lot of reading but they're interesting so I didn't mind. No lockdown browser. All assignments/tests are due on Monday of the next week by 5am. Would definitely take again.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Miles Sensei is the coolest teacher I have ever taken. Her classes are fun and engaging and she is very passionate about Asia. She expects a lot from her students but she is MORE than willing to sit down and talk to you if you're struggling. Love her so much and will be taking her again. Also, she's very blunt. Not rude.

I don't know why there are bad reviews on Professor Miles. I took her ASIA 1102 online course during the summer semester. It is very reading, lecture, essay heavy; however, if you pay attention the quizzes and essays are not hard at all. She was so understanding during my surgery. I ended up acing the class and plan on taking her other classes.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Lecture heavy

comment: I loved her class. She is amazing. Very energetic and passionate. She cares about the material. She can ramble a bit but makes up for it with online video continuations. She requires a lot of boring reading. Her quizzes are still very straightforward and the final is a combination of all the quizzes. Essays were short and simple to do. Loved it!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: The weekly quizzes were simple & based on class lectures. There werent rubrics given for the group midterm/final. Instead, she gave us vague and open-ended instructions. I showed her my work, to which she responded it looks great, only for her to take off a ton of points on my final. Interesting, but be prepared for unclear grading criteria.

Quizzes are medium hard, just pay attention to the power points. Quizzes every Thursday, normally three response questions. Lowkey rude. Final project had few guidelines to follow but she would mark off for things she didn't tell us we needed. Didn't understand memes??

Amazing class until you get to the final/midterm group project. She is not clear at all with what she wants and if you change what she didn't like on the midterm she will find new things wrong on the final. Throughout the course, you have a quiz every week which are pretty simple. Overall interesting class but hard final/midterm group project.

Don't buy the book if you're taking her love and sex course. Barely used it, the quizzes are easy just pay attention to powerpoints. She seems kinda stressed all the time, but she really cares about this material. Theres a group project that's easy and she has no written final

Professor Miles is a great instructor. I felt the class is pretty easy. A quiz every week (super easy, 2-3 questions over PowerPoints), and group project. No tests and no final! I didn't use the book, so I would hold off on buying the book.
Dr. Miles is one of the best professors I have ever had. She always makes herslef available if you need to talk to her, and she is very understanding if you have problems.

Dr. Miles is a very dedicated and funny professor and she is very fair. There are four quizzes, a take home midterm, a presentation assignment, and a group final project. Attendance counts. She is always striving to improve, very accessible, and gives clear instructions. Highly recommend. Just take notes and study and youll be fine.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: super nice and funny. no tests. 3 mini essays (3-4 pages)then the final essay is 6-7 pages. allowed 2 free class skips, begins to take points off for every class skipped after. easy A plus the material is interesting
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr. Miles is a solid professor. She isn't the absolute best and the class isn't the easiest A, but she is a good professor and her classes are interesting. Show up, study a bit, be prepared for group work, and you will do very well. She was always willing to work with students. If you like Japan or Asia in general, her class is great.

Prof Miles is an amazing. She knows so much in her field of study and breaks it down, she cares about getting to know everyone in the class, helping where she can, there are no tests just writing assignments, you get plenty of time, which is a huge plus to those who hate tests. Also her lectures are like conversation. Clear and including. TAKE HER.
